result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony M Thoma was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: (1).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.

Statements made as to sentencing by State, Defense and Defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve TWENTY-EIGHT (28) DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for TWENTY-EIGHT (28) days time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION/PROBATION:

* Restitution payable to ULTA BEAUTY for $266.00 or civil judgment with tax intercept.  Bail to be applied if applicable.  Payable first during probation and that explicitly includes payment before DOC supervision fees.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees BY 01-04-2017 or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered WITH TAX INTERCEPT.

Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Post-conviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction.
JusticePoint DPA Discharge Summary.  Filed, sdg.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court, defendant Anthony M Thoma not in court, in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant is in custody in Waukesha County.  Court ordered matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Revocation hearing.  Hearing scheduled for January 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
(1).  On behalf of Defendant.  Filed, sdg.
Email from Chris Honecker (JusticePoint).

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court reviews submitted documents.  Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Court admonishes Defendant for positive UA's.  Court orders matter adjourned for Review to Br. 33  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with Attorney Jeff Schwarz for attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  LM  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point/WCS Case Worker Chris Honecker.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time, but Scheduled an bail review date.  Case calendared for Bail Review on November 18, 2015in Branch 33.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Court holds colloquy with Defendant.  Defendant to continue co-operating with the DPA.  Court orders matter adjourned to Br. 33 for Review.  Review hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Dated 10-23-2015.  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Barbara K Due for Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Prior to case being called on the Record staffing was held with Case manager, Counsel for the Defense, ADA and the Court off the Record in Chambers.  Matter in Court to address JusticePoint Violation report.  Hearing proceeds on the Record.    

Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.  SANCTION: Court orders 1 (ONE) day in jail.  Then revert back to PR bond with turnover to JusticePoint.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  COURT STAYS SANCTION UNTIL 4:30pm, 10-20-2015.
JusticePoint DPA Non-compliance Report dated 10-20-2015.  Filed, sdg.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. sdg

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
Court has reviewed all recently submitted reports.  Defendant has numerous refusals.  State will allow DPA to continue AND extend agreement.  Defense does not object.  Defendant to provide 3 (THREE) negative UA's, complete Community Service and pay restitution.  Review hearing scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint DPA Progress Report.  Filed, sdg.
Court ordered turnover to Justice Point.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Anthony M Thoma in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by parties.  Court orderes bail modified to signature bond.  Case adjourned for review hearing to Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Defendant Anthony M Thoma in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Court vacates the warrant.  Defendant missed appointment for Vivitrol.  Defendant needs a higher level of monitoring.  Case to be added to the staffing agenda.

All parties notified, effective August 1, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Carl Ashley, Branch 33, in room 113 in the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Review hearing scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Court issued a warrant on 7/13/2015.  Defendant is currently in custody on warrant.  Case is adjourned for a Return on Warrant on 7/28/2015, in br. 6.  Parties notified.  lms
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas in court.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE RECALLED.

  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant is having trouble maintaining sobriety.  Case was staffed.  Defendant was orders to continue treatment.  Case passed.  Defendant to report to JP for testing.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant has made all JusticePoint contacts.  Defendant testing positive.  Defendant to resume attendance at the Dewey Center.

  Review hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Report, received and filed.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Defendant attended 3 of 5 appointments.  Case to be staffed on 5/20/2015.  Defendant to report to Justice Point after court.  Defendant needs to pay restitution and assessment fee and complete community service.  Court orally modifies the DPA to include drug and alcohol test.  Review hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Deferred Prosecution Agreement Progress report, received and filed. lms

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.
Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum  and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms or may not apply for conceal and carry permit.

Defendant Anthony M Thoma in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes Cuevas.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court appearance scheduled in Room 310, Safety Building, on 3/23/15 @ 1:30pm
